info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 1:37PM CDT until July 12 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Taylor.
* WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms extending from Abilene southwest through Buffalo Gap and Tuscola. This will cause urban and small stream flooding especially across the City of Abilene. Ponding of water on roadways and flooding of poor drainage areas can be expected.
- Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abilene, Wylie, Tye, Tuscola, Buffalo Gap, Caps, View, Dyess Afb, Potosi, Impact, Kirby Lake, Camp Tonkawa and Lake Abilene.
- This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 274 and 292.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
